qas.question: HOw many cases of diarrhea are there a year?
How often do kids get diarrhea in developing countries?
Frequent episodes of diarrhea are common in what type of cases?
What long term issues can arise from frequent diarrhea?

answers.text: stunted growth and poor intellectual development

qas.question: What do frequent episodes of stunted growth cause?
How many cases of malnutrition happen per year?

plausible_answers.text: stunted growth and poor intellectual development

qas.question: What long term issues can happen from frequent malnutrition?
How often do kids have malnutrition in developing countries?
What is the estimate of total deaths from stunted growth in 2013?

context: <b5_0>About <a0_0>1.7 to 5 billion cases<b5_0/><a0_0/> of diarrhea occur per year. It is most common in developing countries, where young children get diarrhea on <a1_0><b7_0>average three times a year<b7_0/><a1_0/>. Total deaths from diarrhea are estimated at <b8_0>1.26 million<b8_0/> in 2013 – down from 2.58 million in 1990. In 2012, it is the second most common cause of deaths in children younger than five (0.76 million or 11%). Frequent episodes of diarrhea are also a common cause of <a2_0><b4_0>malnutrition<b4_0/><a2_0/> and the most common cause in those younger than five years of age. Other long term problems that can result include <a3_0><b6_0>stunted growth and poor intellectual development<b6_0/><a3_0/>.
